intro: Chlamydoboea sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions and prefers well-drained soil. It has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Chlamydoboea sinensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
